topic.title: Several Volumens under docker
topic.body:
My HDD gets to small and i want to attach one or several other HDDs to support Zeronet via docker nofish/zeronet

While trying this:

docker run -d -e "ENABLE_TOR=true" -v /media/veracrypt2/Zero/:/root/data -v /media/len/1b899c20-f8d2-40ea-b745-20d37006fb9a/Zero/:/root/data -p 15441:15441 -p 127.0.0.1:43110:43110 
nofish/zeronet 

I do get the following error message:

docker: Error response from daemon: Duplicate mount point: /root/data

How can i connect several volumes as (one) data source please?

topic.title: ResilioSync
topic.body: Did resilio stop working in China, havent seen a message or key in ages?

1615914969_1JBQz17hPq1gGpFB3Y385fJiKDCeS.body:
I wouldnt call it ages,it did run late last year.

Are there any more details about this? I mean that was a great tool to share...

1614774386_1DwZPxVycEyeuvYDJFjAZfF3A8SGt.body:
> [mfs](#comment_120_1B8Nj3YZQSgw2aqhrHof5w73RpP6Xk2a7W): Here you go: [...]

Could you please show up ipv4 as well?

> [anshorei](#comment_174_1CgdRv2BFaVqNfmK3qGVYDuA7EDmk8dJVS): You can check the logs: ZeroNet checks what your IP is during the startup process IIRC. [...]

This stats page seems not to give an IP on the mobile version?

Furthermore it is showing the owm IP while Tor is set to always on and confirms that by showing up the green button. That looks strange to me ?

> [sigune](#comment_3_1JBQz17hPq1gGpFB3Y385fJiKDCeSB2vXe): This stats page seems not to give an IP on the mobile version? [...]

After restarting in "Tor always mode" it shows the correct Tor address now
